channel.title: Windows XP
channel.description: I know windows XP is outdated but the people who have no money to buy a new pc are screwed. I have windows xp atm because my old hardrive crashed and I don't have a 7 disc, But I tried installing skype and it no longer supports Windows XP Home. I think its ridiculous that the people who cant afford a new pc that use windows 7,8 etc.. No longer get updates me its really no big deal i can download them manually but most people can't. I said what I wanted if I wasted your time I'm truly sorry I just don't like the fact that people who use XP no longer get updates.... If this is in the wrong section please move...

item.title: Windows XP
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“RUNE-PK, post:1, topic:541453”]I know windows XP is outdated but the people who have no money to buy a new pc are screwed.
I have windows xp atm because my old hardrive crashed and I don’t have a 7 disc, But I tried installing skype and it no longer supports Windows XP Home. I think its ridiculous that the people who cant afford a new pc that use windows 7,8 etc… No longer get updates me its really no big deal i can download them manually but most people can’t. I said what I wanted if I wasted your time I’m truly sorry I just don’t like the fact that people who use XP no longer get updates… If this is in the wrong section please move…[/quote]
I could easily hook you up with a Win 7 key (it should be a real, non-pirated, legal one). You’d just have to get the actual OS onto a disc and install it.

Shaloxis:

Or… you just get it illigal, it isn’t hard to download it on a disk and install it.[/quote][quote=“eyeownyew, post:5, topic:541453”]You could also always pirate it… Nothing really happens when you do

^These guys are right… won’t go into details but if you need a link I can pm you some for win7…

Ashi:

Linux is the better free alternative.

She’s also right… Linux has been proven to be better (in one way or another). Windows is just user friendly.

[quote=“Spades, post:4, topic:541453”]I don’t know why it is such a big deal, they are dropping support for an OS that is 13 years old. It isn’t hard to get Windows 7. You can buy a Windows 7 key for like 50 bucks right now.

When this[spoiler]
[/spoiler] was what RuneScape looked like.

And they aren’t forcing you to update. They are just dropping support for it. Meaning no new Microsoft updates.

Edit: http://www.oldversion.com/windows/skype/

There you go, you can download an older version of Skype. I am running Skype 5.something.[/quote]
Yet again, another option.

This thread is just a rant. Don’t rant because you’re using outdated hardware/software. It’s only logical that Skype, Adobe, Visio, etc update and stop trying to be backwards compatible for something that was made over a decade ago.

I remember when I was learning ActionScript 2, and thought it was a pain (in some areas). Then ActionScript 3 came out (which was only supported on the most recent Adobe Flash and whatnot) and made things sooooo much easier. But I didn’t even get to really use AS3 for a while because everyone was still on 2 and you’d only get the like 20 people that did update to see it. So I had to make everything in AS2 until the more recent versions of Adobe were the norm.

Read full topic

Read full topic

item.title: Windows XP
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Fat Cookies:

I’m sorry but if you “can’t afford” windows 7/8 then there’s some serious issues. If you can’t afford Visio, or Visual Studio or the adobe suite, then fair play, but paying a small fee for an up to date operating system is far from being unreasonable.

While I agree, there can be a cost of hardware involved as well if the system is from 2000 - 2003 as well, so then you’re looking at £300+

Read full topic

item.description:
@Spades wrote:

I don’t know why it is such a big deal, they are dropping support for an OS that is 13 years old. It isn’t hard to get Windows 7. You can buy a Windows 7 key for like 50 bucks right now.

When this[spoiler]
[/spoiler] was what RuneScape looked like.

And they aren’t forcing you to update. They are just dropping support for it. Meaning no new Microsoft updates.

Edit: http://www.oldversion.com/windows/skype/

There you go, you can download an older version of Skype. I am running Skype 5.something.
